pages.text: The first room you enter after jumping into the Vault Dimension is the $(l)Portal Room$(), this is your exit when you are unable to complete the Vault's objective when the Vault does not have the $(l)Locked$() Modifier. $(br2)The $(l) Vault Compass $() will always show it's needle to the direction of the portal.

$(br)Every Vault is $(l)Randomly Generated$() and rolls one of the themes, meaning each room in that Vault expresses the same theme, affecting liquids and particles. $(br2)The vault's size is scaled to player level. Each room after the portal room has four different potential corridors to new rooms. Not every corridor is open in each room.

Vault rooms have different rarity ratings. The $(l)Common Room$() is worth the explore, with the availability of chests, God Altars, Treasure Rooms and Small Dungeons. $(br2)$(l)Challenge Rooms$() are dangerous but more rewarding than common rooms. $(br2)$(l)Omega Rooms$() are peaceful, meaning no mobs will spawn, while it contains the best loot.

Point of Interest locations in the Vault are spots where you find loot, but carry risk with mob spawners. $(br2) $(l)Mini dungeons$() spawn inside Common Rooms that contain more loot than poi's, but also carry a greater risk.
